entry.title: Re: Bank reprocess allocating payments to the wrong custo...
entry.content:
Standard algorithm 001 checks field reference and document number. 

Verify open items in that customer account - if there is a document with very short and/or unspecific reference, like "10" or "25" or "invoice" then there is very big chance that such number appeared also in the payment memo line in the bank statement, for example: "Payment for invoice on 09/10/25".

It is working fine.

How can we migrate those values from the old system during open item migration? AP migration will include open invoices that should be complete, with long invoice number. As far as I checked, the migration template does not include that fields, even when ODN field is configured in the system. 

What should be done to migrate the values of ODN fields as part of AP/AR open items migration?

BR

Małgorzata

entry.title: Re: MMPV _closing the period - runtime error as 'DBSQL_DU...
entry.content:
The error typically occurs when the system attempts to insert a record into a database table that already contains a record with the same key. In the context of MMPV (period close), this may involve tables like CKMLPP, CKMLCR, or MLHD, which store material ledger and period data. SAP Note 3202191 addresses a known issue but may not cover all scenarios, especially if the database already contains inconsistent or duplicate entries.

To fix this issue,

analyze the Short Dump via ST22, Identify the exact table and key causing the duplicate error. Look for lines like INSERT <TABLE_NAME> or DBIF_DSQL2_ARRAY_INSERT.  If you are not familiar with ST22, take the help of ABAP team and find out the root cause.

go to SE14, check the affected table for duplicate entries. If safe and confirmed, you may need to manually delete or adjust the duplicate record (only in a test or sandbox system first).

Use transactions like CKMSTART, CKM3, or CKM3N to verify material ledger consistency. Run CKMC to check for open periods and inconsistencies.

entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have the non-released CDS I_RERENTALOBJECT which we need to use for our custom development.

Extend SAP S_4HANA in the cloud and on premise with ABAP based extensions

Page no- 42

After we create the Custom CDS, if we are not set the API state to released

Package – Default ABAP Language version – standard ABAP

Base CDS View

We are using the ATC check Variant ABAP_CLOUD_READINESS are getting the error

On top of the base CDS ZI_RERENTALOBJECT_POC which is API state is not set to release.

We are creating the new CDS on top of ZI_RERENTALOBJECT_POC under the package where the default ABAP Language Version to ABAP for Cloud Development.

When are executing with the ATC variant ABAP_CLOUD_READINESS there are no error found

Query is in case if the custom CDS or custom objects which are not released how we can be able to raise the Error in ATC check. We have created the custom ATC variant below are the screen shots.

Is there any options to capture error for above use case via ATC check with the screen shots are much appreciated

We are getting the same result

 @ThFiedler  @OlgaDolinskaja

entry.title: Re: Pasting multiple components in maintenance order comp...
entry.content:
Hi Daniel Cauba

Currently, SAP does not provide a standard feature that allows you to directly paste multiple components from Excel into the Components tab of a Maintenance Order (IW31 / IW32). The standard functionality only supports copying components from an existing order or template, but bulk pasting from the clipboard is not available. However, it is possible to use a script-based approach as a workaround.

The standard and recommended method is to prepare a Bill of Material (BOM) for the equipment or functional location (using transaction IB01). Then, in the Components tab of the order(IW31-IW32), by clicking the List button, all items from the BOM will be displayed, and you can select all of them directly from the menu.

I hope this answer helps improve your work process and provides some clarity for your approach

entry.title: Re: Invalid character/Bad Character removal in BW4HANA using AMDP Class
entry.content:
Hi Lakshminarasimhan

 

The usage of [:print:] might cause a problem if the loaded data contains non-latin characters  like:

  • japanese
  • chinese
  • cyrillic
  • etc

So this:

SELECT
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T1" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T1,
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T2" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T2,
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T3" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T3,
replace_regexpr( '([^[:print:]]|[#|!])' in "T4" with ' ' occurrence all ) as T4
FROM ( SELECT
'祝你今天愉快 Aabc123' as T1,
'Приємного дня! Aabc123' as T2,
'良い一日を Aabc123' as T3,
'Have a nice day Aabc123' as T4
FROM dummy)

has the effect, that every which are non-latin characters will be also removed.

 

See the KBA:

3386808 Unexpected result when replace_regexpr and :PRINT: is used in a HANA transformation

 

Br,

Roland

entry.title: SAC Rapid Finance (S/4HC Public, 2FM / guide 2JV) — Actuals OK, but Copy→Plan writes 0 and Ca
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re deploying SAP Analytics Cloud Rapid Finance on S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. We followed configuration guide 2JV and have scope item 2FM active.

Environment

  • S/4: Public Edition (2FM active)

  • SAC content/model: SAP_FI_FPA_S4_Finance_Planning (FPA1 / H1)

  • Versions: public.Actual (OK), public.Plan (targets)

  • CoA: YCOA master; YBSE is an alternative CoA (no hierarchy in S/4)

  • Org master: No hierarchies for Cost Center/Profit Center/Functional Area (leafs only)

What works

  • Actuals import runs and we can report Actuals in SAC (P&L/BS).

Issues

  1. Copy Actuals → Plan (delivered step) runs but writes 0 to Plan.

  2. Cash Flow (Indirect) doesn’t populate the 13 CF lines. We added the CF accounts in SAC.

  3. GLAccountBalanceFlow import finishes, but ~30% rows are rejected.

What we already did

  • Account dimension: Exported, then manually mapped ACCTYPEand Rate Type (Closing/Average) because S/4 account types (e.g., X, P…) didn’t map 1:1.

  • Added 13 CF holder accounts in SAC (all ACCTYPE=EXP, RateType=Average):
    1000100, 1000210, 1000310, 1000320, 1000330, 1000350, 1000360, 2000111, 2000210, 2000400, 3000100, 3000200, 3000300.
    Initially not in a hierarchy; we then adjusted our AFL to reference them directly to avoid compile errors—still no CF values written.

  • Copy AFL (simplified) tried in addition to delivered step (uses target version’s Start/End date, includes # members or removes org dims, writes to AUDIT_TRAIL="SAC"):

CONFIG.HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT].[h/H1]
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
MEMBERSET [d/AUDIT_TRAIL] = "SAC"
MEMBERSET [d/SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT] = BASEMEMBER([d/SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT].[h/H1], "FPA1/08","FPA1/00ASSETS","FPA1/00LIABILITS")
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version]="public.Actual")

  • GLAccountBalanceFlow query (for the Finance model import) - typical filters used:

    • Controlling Area = A000

    • Ledger = 0L

    • GLAcct Type Flow = PLCHANGING; …

    • Fiscal Period = 1 → 12

    • Fiscal Year of Ledger = 2025
      Job finishes, but the monitor shows a high “Rejected” count.

Questions for the community

  1. Copy step writing 0: common causes in Rapid Finance? (e.g., version not in Edit, publish/locks, AuditTrail choice, required Measures, missing # in org dims, etc.)

  2. Cash-Flow (Indirect):

    • Must the 13 CF holder accounts be in H1 under specific parents, or is “existing as leafs” enough?

    • Are ACCTYPE=EXP and RateType=Average the expected properties for these CF lines?

  3. GLAccountBalanceFlow rejections (~30%): Where do you typically find the root cause? (dimension validation, account attributes, currency/rate-type, hierarchy assumptions…) Any checklist?

  4. Any official mapping guidance from S/4 account type codes (X, P, etc.) to SAC ACCTYPE and Rate Type used by Rapid Finance?

  5. With YCOA master and YBSE alternative (no S/4 hierarchies), are there extra steps needed so Rapid Finance acts like the content expects?

Evidence I can attach

  • Import run log (showing “Rejected” rows)

  • GLAccountBalanceFlow filter screenshot

  • FPA1/H1 snippet + CF accounts list

  • Data Action run screenshots and AFL snippets

Any pointers or a working checklist would be hugely appreciated. Thanks!

Axel Mutombo

entry.title: Re: S/4 Cloud: Local Event Consumption not getting triggered
entry.content:
Hi @yoppy_santoso1,

I raised an incident for this. SAP then reactivated the corresponding RAP behavior definition, then it worked. Unfortunately you cannot do this yourself, since it is an SAP standard object (at least I don't know any way to do it without getting an authorization error in eclipse during activation). You might also try to just bring your implementation to your test system, maybe the issue is only on dev (even though this is not nice, but if you want to speed things up, it might be worth a try). If you raise an incident, you could tell SAP that they found a solution for this in incident nr. 815224/2025 (maybe that helps speeding things up as well). Of course I can't know if really have the same issue as we had.

Best regards
Daniel

entry.title: SAP Joule for Developers Expands to Private Cloud: Accelerating ABAP Innovation and Transformation
entry.content:
Key Highlights

  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition 2025.
  • New Custom Code Migration capabilities accelerate the transformation of classic ERP code to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, including:
    • Documentation Chat - Get accurate answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications.
    • ABAP Program Explain - Understand the business purpose and logic of legacy code.
    • Explain for SAP S/4HANA Test Cockpit Issues - Diagnose and resolve S/4HANA-related Test Cockpit issues using context from simplification items and cookbooks.

Earlier this year, SAP introduced Joule for Developers — a set of embedded artificial intelligence capabilities in SAP Build, including ABAP, that helps developers accelerate application and extension development, reduce costs, and boost productivity.

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, version 2025, providing comprehensive support for ABAP Cloud use cases. The release also introduces the first Custom Code Migration capabilities, bringing a powerful suite of AI-assisted capabilities purpose-built for ABAP development and cloud delivery.

Best of all, Joule for Developers remains free of charge, enabling customers and partners to integrate it into daily operations and accelerate innovation without commercial barriers.

 

What’s Included

This release for Private Cloud delivers AI-powered support for the core development scenarios ABAP developers rely on every day. Key capabilities include:

  • inline code completion,
  • ABAP/CDS code explanation,
  • automated unit test generation for ABAP and ABAP core data services (CDS),
  • RAP business objects generation,
  • RAP predictive business logic, and
  • OData consumption.

All capabilities are designed to accelerate development, improve code quality, and boost productivity from day one. Additionally, this release introduces the first wave of Custom Code Migration capabilities, designed to accelerate the move from classic SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Cloud Edition. These AI-powered features simplify code analysis and adaptation by:

  • Providing Documentation Chat for quick answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications:

 

  • Using ABAP Program Explain to clarify the business purpose and implementation logic of legacy code:

 

  • Explaining ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) findings with step-by-step guidance on how to fix the issues, based on simplification items and technical documentation:

 

All capabilities are designed to reduce manual effort, speed up migration projects, and help your teams to modernize their ABAP landscapes with great confidence.

The ABAP AI software development kit, powered by Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management, is now available and offers centralized access to the generative AI hub in SAP AI Core. It leverages the same robust platform SAP uses internally, delivering proven, production-grade infrastructure to customer landscapes. With simplified configuration and governance, development teams can adopt AI capabilities quickly, providing a significant boost to integration efforts.

 

Why This Matters

Private cloud customers require strict governance, security, and operational control - yet they also seek the speed and innovation modern AI-driven development delivers. This release addresses both priorities by enabling:

  • faster development cycles with AI-assisted coding and test generation,
  • stronger knowledge transfer through automated code explanations and copilot interactions,
  • higher delivery quality with automated testing and code migration support, and
  • secure innovation within controlled environments.

 

Looking Ahead

We’re building on this momentum with a series of targeted deliveries aligned to upcoming releases across the BTP ABAP Environment and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Planned updates for BTP ABAP Environment 2511, 2602, and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 include:

  • documentation generation capabilities,
  • enhanced explanations for reports in the Custom Code Migration application,
  • AI-enabled insights on Clean Core–related ATC findings directly within the Custom Code Migration application,
  • code migration and adaptation proposals to support developers working on RISE code adaptation,
  • ABAP CDS annotation and metadata extension generation, and
  • ABAP CDS analytical model generation.

These enhancements will extend Joule’s impact beyond code completion and test generation, supporting documentation, migration and Clean Core compliance, analytical use cases, and addressing more stages of the end-to-end development lifecycle.

 

Free Offer Extended

SAP Joule for Developers will remain free of charge. The extended promotion ensures that all customers and partners can continue to use Joule for Developers capabilities for free.

Access can be requested using the material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer now extends beyond the BTP ABAP environment and SAP Cloud ERP Public Edition to include SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition customers running the latest 2025 release.

 

Closing Remarks

SAP Joule for Developers’ delivery for Private Cloud is a significant milestone — combining end-to-end ABAP Cloud with AI use cases, innovative code migration scenarios, and a standardized ABAP AI SDK to bring practical AI assistance directly into everyday development workflows.

With extended free of charge access, we invite every customer and partner to explore SAP Joule for Developers, push its boundaries, and help shape the future of AI-assisted ABAP development.

Start using SAP Joule for Developers today and join us in building the next generation of intelligent, AI-driven ABAP innovation.

For a deeper dive, read the blog post by Simona Marincei, head of ABAP AI.

Learn more about SAP Joule for Developers capabilities here.

entry.title: Re: SAP certificate renewal - practical guide
entry.content:
Hi @DurgaKalyan1 

the updated certificate should be provided by the holder of the private key, ie. the party with which you communicate. The public certificate is used to encrypt the message or to verify signature. The private key is used to decrypt the message or to sign. So if your communication partner is decrypting your messages, it should provide you with the certificate.

Nevertheless, this is a reverse scenario to one I was describing in the blog. The blog is about when you are the owner of the private part of the certificate, like in the case of the SAP certificate.

In your case, your partner should inform you about the certificate exchange in time and provide you with the new certificate. You can send them this blog 🙂

entry.title: Automating Job Requisition Creation Without Middleware
entry.content:
In this article, I’ll walk you through how to automate job requisition creation in SAP SuccessFactors—without relying on any middleware solutions. By leveraging Intelligence Services Center (ISC) and Integration Center, we can streamline the process and reduce dependency on external systems.

Key Events Used in ISC:

  1. Update a Position
  2. New Position

These events allow us to trigger requisition creation automatically. Depending on the business need, you can configure the system to generate either:

  • Approved Requisitions: Set IsDraft = false and ensure all mandatory fields are populated.
  • Pre-Approved Requisitions: Set IsDraft = true and map relevant position attributes.

Process Overview:

Process 1:
When a new position is created in the system, the Intelligent Services Center (ISC) event is automatically triggered. This event initiates the integration flow, which seamlessly creates the corresponding job requisition—no middleware is required for this process.

To implement this automation, we need to create an integration specifically for the ISC event: New Position.

Steps to Create the Integration:

  1. Navigate to Integration Center in your SAP SuccessFactors instance.
  2. Click on “Create” to start a new integration.
  3. Select “More Integration Types” to access additional integration templates.
  4. Choose the appropriate template or start from scratch, depending on your requirements.
  5. Configure the integration to listen for the New Position ISC event and define the logic to create a job requisition accordingly.

Now, set the Trigger Type to Intelligent Services.
For both the Source Type and Destination Type, select SuccessFactors.
Ensure the Format is set to OData.

After clicking on create button, select the intelligent service as shown below.

 

Selecting the Appropriate ISC Event and Configuring the Integration

  • If the integration should automatically create a job requisition whenever a new position is created, select the ISC event: “New Position”.
  • If the integration should trigger when an existing position is updated, select the ISC event: “Update to a Position”.

Once the appropriate Intelligent Services event is selected:

  1. The Source Type will automatically be set to Position.
  2. Next, define the Destination system (SuccessFactors).
  3. Proceed to map the required entities and fields between the source and destination to ensure accurate data flow.

Select the Destination type as Job requisition

Now, proceed to map the necessary fields from the Position object to the Job Requisition object.
This step ensures that all relevant data from the position is accurately transferred to the requisition during the integration process.

Mandatory Job Requisition Fields and Their Values

The following fields in the Job Requisition entity must be populated during integration to ensure successful creation:

S.No

Field

Value

Condition/Notes

1

Application Template ID

Template ID

Must match the ID defined in the Job Requisition template.

2

Internal Status

0 for Pre-Approved
1 for Approved

Determines the initial approval status of the requisition.

3

Application Status Set ID

Status Set ID

Should align with the status set configured in the Job Requisition template.

4

Template ID

Requisition Template ID

Must correspond to the correct Job Requisition template.

5

IsDraft

True – for Pre-Approved
False – for Approved

If set to False, ensure all mandatory fields are mapped and populated.

 

Map the required fields between the Position and Job Requisition entities as outlined below:

S.No

Field Type

Mapping

1

Object

Position_object.externalCode → JobReq_object.externalCode

2

Picklist

Position_picklist.optionID → JobReq_picklist.ID (type: int64)

3

String

Position_field → JobReq_field

After completing the field mapping between the Position and Job Requisition entities, apply a filter based on the "To Be Hired" flag.

  • This filter ensures that the integration only triggers for positions marked as eligible for hiring.
  • By adding this condition, the system will create job requisitions only for positions where the "To Be Hired" flag is enabled.

Once the filter is configured:

  1. Validate the integration setup to ensure all mappings and conditions are correctly defined.
  2. Click Save to finalize and activate the integration.

 

Solution :

To trigger the integration and automatically create a job requisition:

  • Create a new position either through the Position Org Chart or by importing data.
  • Once the position is created and meets the defined criteria (e.g., To Be Hired flag is enabled), the integration will automatically generate the corresponding Job Requisition.


Role Assignment and Route Map Configuration in Job Requisition

In the Job Requisition, roles can be dynamically assigned using Save Rules. Based on these rules, the Route Map is automatically updated to reflect the appropriate users involved in the approval and hiring process.

Extending the Same Logic to ISC Event: "Update to a Position"

Similarly, you can configure the Intelligent Services event: “Update to a Position” to trigger the integration.

  • Whenever this event is raised (e.g., due to a change in position details), the integration will execute and automatically create or update the Job Requisition based on the updated position data.
  • This ensures that any significant changes to an existing position—such as a change in department, location, or hiring need—can seamlessly initiate the requisition process without manual intervention.

 

Automating Job Requisition Creation Using Intelligent Services and Integration Center

By leveraging the Intelligent Services Center (ISC) and Integration Center, you can automate the creation of Job Requisitions based on updates to Position details and predefined default values.

Additionally, if your organization uses multiple Job Requisition templates, you can utilize lookup tables within Integration Center to dynamically select the appropriate template. This can be achieved by configuring conditional logic based on specific Position field values.

 For example:

  • If Position.Department,Input code = "Sales", use Template Output code -XXX
  • If Position.Department.Input code = "Service", use Template Output code -YYY

This approach ensures that the correct requisition template is applied automatically, improving accuracy and reducing manual effort.



SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting

entry.title: How to assign storage process for Manually created HU in inbound
entry.content:
Hello EWM team,

I would need some suggestion on having storage process in EWM.

Scenario: (System WD4)

Plant A - During receiving, we will pack the material with auto pack & that HU will get packspec & Storage process assigned. So, that HU is activated for storage control with storage process. (attached screen)
After receiving, while creating putaway task - this will be HU task.

Plant B - During receiving, we will pack the material with external number & manually. So, this HU will not get storage process assigned. (attached screen) Hence when creating putaway task - this will be product warehouse task. 

Now, in order to have intermediate step in plant B before doing putaway to final bin - How can I assign storage process to HU (which is manually created)?
If not possible, is there a way that I can achieve bringing intermediate step (taking material to other work center) before doing putaway to final bin?
I request you to suggest me please, your suggestion is really helpful

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to dynamically change the names and le...
entry.content:
Dear tsuuuu,

to change the description (and legend) of measures you need to

  1. define two restricted measures in your story (one for previous year, one for actual year)
  2. restrict them via calculation input control
  3. use the text of the calculation input control for the measure description

As a result you have two calculation input controls influencing the description of each measure dynamically:

Does it help you?

Kind regards

Tano

entry.title: Re: S/4 HANA Public Cloud_How to configure the process te...
entry.content:
Hello @lea_hanh 

The Process Template in Manage Mass Maintenance – Business Partners (New) is sourced from MDG Mass Processing in S4HANA Public Cloud.

If the list is empty and the Start button is disabled, it indicates either that no MDG configuration has been set up yet or that your role/scope is incomplete.

What should you do?

Authorisations
Make sure your role includes the catalogues for: Manage Mass Maintenance – Business Partners (New), and MDG Mass Processing (Version 2) (app F1686A).
Check catalogues in the Fiori Apps Library and add them to Maintain Business Roles.

Create/activate a template in MDG
Open MDG Mass Processing (Version 2) → Create a Configuration for the Business Partner object (for example, Address change), select the fields, then save and activate it. This configuration will then be available as a Process Template in your BP mass project.

Go back to Manage Mass Maintenance – Business Partners (New), create the project, pick your template, and start. 

If the dropdown remains empty after an upgrade,
this specific issue is documented for 2508: see KBA 3663145 and KBA 3122300. Follow the guidance on successor apps and template visibility.

SAP Support Portal-3663145 - No Process Template shown when creating Mass Maintenance Process after 2508 upgrade

SAP Support Portal-3122300 - How to Perform Mass Changes to Customer/Supplier Business Partners in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Check to Use customized Calendar-Year as Fiscal Year with Friday Month-End (instead of K4)
entry.content:
Hi Team, 

        We are currently using fiscal year variant K4 (Calendar Year: 12 normal + 4 special periods) in our DEV & QA tenant.
Our business requirement is to keep a calendar-year fiscal year (Jan–Dec)   but have each month end on a Friday . If the last calendar day of the month is not a Friday, , the month should extend to the following Friday, , even if that Friday, falls in the next calendar month. This “Friday,  month-end” rule must apply consistently for all months and years.

 

We need SAP confirmation on supportability in S/4HANA (Public Cloud) and the exact enablement steps. Our Production system is not yet set up and there are no productive postings, so we want to implement this now if possible.

 

Hence requesting to provide your expertise advise in this at the earliest.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. Use SSCUI DIGITS - Maintain Fiscal Year
  2. Use "SZ-Configurable template variant" or New Entries
  3. Configure the each period with ending PERSON_NAME
  4. Assign that FY Variant to Company Code - SSCUI-DIGITS (we are not able to change here)





------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Check to Use customized Calendar-Year as Fiscal Year...
entry.content:
See help.sap.com documentation Changing the Default Fiscal Year Variant
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/ab27e4be7cb04e4bb292dff2987f25ba.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

from same you can see Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/497a54d1c7714de69a4b1fa3012ebfdd.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

which also references 

For information on the available fiscal year variants and to find the FYV that suits your needs, start the SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer and go to the Accelerators. From the Explore section, open the Supported Fiscal Year Variants file (.xlsx).

note the following

Global Fiscal Year is decided during initial scoping as part of "Specifying Primary Finance Settings"  No changes are allowed for this FYV after initial scoping is completed.

Alternative FYV for non-leading ledger can be changed in case there are no postings for a specific company code.


see Also the help.sap.com documentation on 
Alternative Fiscal Year Variant

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/9dda2d38e0e74490a99dcaf5b5c678f3.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

see Restrictions and Dependencies 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/898187aca48441c793744f2f4e7019dd.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST


see in particular restriction 
The start and end dates of posting periods in fiscal year variants assigned to the non-leading ledger of a company code must not differ from the start and end dates of posting periods in the fiscal year variant assigned to the leading ledger. The periods must be of equal length. 

see documentation in full.

entry.title: Tip for ABAPers Working with Door Assignment in SAP EWM
entry.content:
If you ever need to change or reassign the Door (Destination Bin) on a Warehouse Task (WT) in an EWM system, here are two standard approaches depending on your business requirement.

1. Change Door and Confirm the WT

If your requirement is to change the door and immediately confirm the WT (data will then be stored in /SCWM/ORDIM_C),
you can use the standard function module: /SCWM/TO_CONFIRM

Make sure to fill the table parameter IT_CONF_EXC with the exception code CHBD (Change Bin),
along with the corresponding BUSCON and EXEC_STEP, which you can verify from SPRO configuration.

Example:
ls_conf_exc-exccode = 'CHBD'.
ls_conf_exc-buscon = 'TPT'.
ls_conf_exc-exec_step = '04'.

2. Change Door and Keep the WT Open

If you need to reassign or correct the door but want to keep the WT status OPEN (data remains in /SCWM/ORDIM_O),
you can use another standard function module: /SCWM/TO_CHANGE_ATT_UPD

This FM allows updating certain WT attributes — including the destination bin (door) — without confirming or recreating the task.

Summary:

ScenarioFunction ModuleWT Status AfterData Saved In
Change door + confirm/SCWM/TO_CONFIRMConfirmed/SCWM/ORDIM_C
Change door but keep open/SCWM/TO_CHANGE_ATT_UPDStill open/SCWM/ORDIM_O

Hope this helps anyone working on EWM Door Assignment adjustments from ABAP!

Best Regards, 
Rosyad

entry.title: SAP MDG: Auto-fill CR Description by Data Model and CR Type Description
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great 🙂

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

BADI Responsible: USMD_CREQUEST_INTEGRATION.

Auto-populate the Change Request Description with the Data Model’s CR Type Description so every MDG CR is consistently and meaningfully described. 

Create Custom implementation & assign Data model filter values.

Method Responsible: if_ex_usmd_crequest_integr~get_crequest_attributes.

Code: 

METHOD if_ex_usmd_crequest_integr~get_crequest_attributes.

    SELECT SINGLE a~usmd_creq_type, a~usmd_model,  b~txtmi        
             FROM usmd110c AS a INNER JOIN
                  usmd110t AS b ON a~usmd_creq_type = b~usmd_creq_type
                               AND a~usmd_model EQ @iv_model
             INTO  @DATA(ls_cr_types)
            WHERE b~langu      EQ @SY-langu AND
                  a~usmd_creq_type = @iv_crequest_type.

    IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
      cv_description = ls_cr_types-txtmi.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.

 

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: Re: ABAP code to wait for the end of "inbound bgRFC type Q" units
entry.content: @BjoernSchulz In fact, I originally developed with CL_ABAP_PARALLEL but I needed queues (to avoid lock issues between parallel tasks) and the class doesn't support queues. I tried bgPF but ABAP 7.58 SP 1 doesn't allow "queued background processes" yet (method GET_FOR_QUEUE absent, it's available in 2505/ABAP version?). It's why I used bgRFC + the method START_INST_IN_BACKGROUND of CL_ABAP_PARALLEL to run each unit.

entry.title: Re: Questions on using Terraform with SAP BTP Trial Account
entry.content:
• When creating the Cloud Foundry environment instance, it’s automatically created with Org Memory set to 0 MB, and I can’t modify it due to restrictions (as mentioned in a previous Q&A). Is this a trial account limitation, or am I missing something?

You need to provide quota in Global Account for Cloud Foundry Runtime - APPLICATION_RUNTIME - MEMORY
As MEMORY is limited you may need to reduce the quota for the automatically provided subaccount.

  • In the Discovery Center mission, the .tfvars file for step 1 requires a custom_idp URL. Starting from a (trial) global account without any existing subaccount, how can I obtain this information? When I do this manually in the trial subaccount, I subscribe to the Cloud Identity Services (default plan) and then establish a trust configuration.

Don't think, that this will work. I guess .tfvars is for an already existing custom idp.
So I think, you need to handover the custom_idp URL via terraform parameters.

entry.title: SAP SF Onboarding External User First Access Language
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we are currently implementing SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, integrated with Recruiting Management, and we’ve come across a confusing and possibly conflicting behaviour regarding locale (language) handling for external new hires.

According to the official SAP documentation — KBA 2997807: How does locale work for External New Hires? — when Onboarding is initiated from Recruiting, the locale selected by the candidate during the creation of their candidate profile is automatically passed to Onboarding. The KBA further states that if the defaultLocale field is mapped via HRIS-sync, that value will override the candidate’s own locale.

“The locale for the external new hire will be updated automatically when you initiate the onboarding process from Recruiting Management. The locale provided by the candidate at the time of candidate profile creation is published by Recruiting Management and the same is consumed by Onboarding. If you also provide any mapping for the defaultLocale field under the data model (HRIS-sync mapping), then that value overrides the locale value that is selected by the new hire as part of the candidate profile.”

However, another document — KBA 3115662: Considerations when syncing defaultLocale from Employee Central to Onboarding — explicitly advises against syncing the defaultLocale field between EC and Onboarding, as this can lead to synchronization issues and unexpected behaviour. This recommendation directly contradicts the approach described in KBA 2997807.

There currently seems to be no clean, end-to-end solution ensuring that the language preference defined by the candidate is respected across Recruiting → Onboarding → EC. From an implementation perspective, this feels like a product gap, since the expected multilingual user experience (especially for first login/reset password screens) depends on these inconsistent behaviours.

Has anyone else encountered this situation or found a stable configuration that ensures consistent locale handling across modules?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

Natálie

entry.title: Re: SAP SF Onboarding External User First Access Language
entry.content:
Hello Natálie,

In my opinion, the two KBAs are not necessarily contradicting themselves I would summarize the product behavior as follows:

  • Locale can be mapped from RCM to ONB
  • But if there is a HRIS Mapping, the mapped value will be overridden
  • You might also check implementation guide: Initiating Onboarding

The locale for the external new hire will be updated automatically, when you initiate the onboarding process from Recruiting Management. The locale provided by the candidate at the time of candidate profile creation is published by Recruiting Management and the same is consumed by Onboarding.

If you also provide any mapping for the defaultLocale field under the data model (hris-sync mapping), then that value overrides the locale value that is selected by the new hire as part of the candidate profile.

Hope this helps,

Kind Regards,
Noemi

entry.title: SAP Asset Performance Management - Useful Link Collection (October 2025)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Asset Performance Management Community,

If you’re looking for demos, documentation, or product updates, you’ll find a link collection below. Note that it's possible to SUBSCRIBE to What's New and webcast updates, as well as get notified if a new blog or question is posed around APM. Information is below! Let us know in the comments below what other resources could be useful.

 

Channel
Category
What can I use this information for?
Subscribe
RoadmapInformationYou can download and share the APM roadmap, display and filter planned and upcoming features by business capability and see the future vision for the product -
SAP Help Portal for SAP Asset Performance ManagementDocumentation

The SAP Help Portal offers a diverse range of documentation for SAP Asset Performance Management including:

  1. User manuals for understanding the basics of our software.
  2. Installation guides to aid users in setting up our products.
  3. Configuration guides for customizing the software as per users' needs.
  4. Administrator guides to maintain, manage and optimize SAP systems.
  5. Developer guides for integrating and extending SAP applications.
  6. Troubleshooting guides for resolving common issues and errors.
  7. Training materials for skill development and software mastery.
  8. Product release notes detailing changes, updates, or new features in each software version.
  9. FAQs that provide quick answers to common user inquiries.
  10. Technical datasheets detailing system requirements and specifications of the software.

-

SAP Asset Performance Management introduces limited releases for new features to selected users, enabling early feedback and refinement before general availability.

On the What's New Page choose "Subscribe" to get email notifications when a new release has been published.

SAP Community for SAP Asset Performance Management (including blogs)Community

The SAP Community is a platform for users, customers, and partners of SAP software to connect, share knowledge, and collaborate on SAP-related topics.

It provides resources such as forums, blogs, and documents to help users troubleshoot issues, share best practices, and learn about new features and functionality in SAP products. The purpose of the SAP Community is to enable customers and partners to get the most out of their SAP software by sharing knowledge and expertise with one another.

You can subscribe to the tag SAP Asset Performance Management to receive blog notifications (also you'll see when questions are asked or queries are answered regarding APM). To do so you need to log on to the SAP Community then choose Subscribe

for SAP Asset Performance Management

entry.title: Event-Based Revenue Recognition: Two Options for Considering Write-Offs During Re-Evaluation
entry.content:
With the release S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502 SAP introduced enhanced flexibility in Event-Based Revenue Recognition (EBRR) for billing elements using revenue recognition keys SPTM and SPTMWP. Specifically, users now have two distinct options for how write-offs are considered during re-evaluation. 

 

Option 1: Default Logic for Considering Write-Offs

By default, re-evaluation only considers write-offs that were posted within or prior to the fiscal period in which the re-evaluation occurs. This logic is active out-of-the-box in the S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Example scenario:

  1. Time allocation or relevant cost postings occur in fiscal period N
  2. Write-off is posted in fiscal period N+1, referencing costs from fiscal period N
  3. The write-off is not considered during the period-end close run in the fiscal period N
  4. The write-off is recognized during the period-end close run in the fiscal period N+1

This approach ensures that only finalized financial data within the current or earlier periods influences revenue recognition.

 

Option 2: Re-Evaluation Considering Future Write-Offs

Alternatively, re-evaluation can be configured to consider all write-offs, including those posted in future periods, as long as they reference billing element items created within or before the current fiscal period.

This option is not active by default and must be enabled via expert configuration. Once activated, it applies system-wide and cannot be limited to specific objects.

To request this configuration, submit a customer incident under the component: CO-PC-OBJ-EBR-2CL

Example scenario:

  1. Time allocation or relevant cost posting occurs in fiscal period N
  2. Billing document is issued in fiscal period N
  3. Write-off is posted in fiscal period N+1, referencing costs from fiscal period N
  4. The future write-off is recognized during the period-end close run in the fiscal period N

This approach allows for more proactive revenue adjustments, even when write-offs are posted after the initial billing period.

 

When is Re-Evaluation Triggered?

Re-evaluation in EBRR is initiated through either of the following apps:

  • F4277 – Run Revenue Recognition – Projects
  • F4767 – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects

These apps assess posted data and adjust revenue recognition accordingly, including the treatment of write-offs.

entry.title: Restrict users from editing a parked invoice
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and my client needs to restrict the possibility of editing parked invoices for some users. They don't use an approval workflow and don't want to, so I need to know if it's possible to add a restriction in a role to achieve that. If yes, what would be that role and that restriction? Or do you now another way to do it?

Thank you in advance and best regards,

Ornella

entry.title: Re: Implementing a Dynamic YTD Filter Up to Yesterday in...
entry.content:
Dear Moritz,

I am not sure, if you are using a date field with day granularity in your model. If you do so, you could use the option to set an own current date variable (for instance, when you create your first restricted measure:

Then, you need to uncheck the system current date check box, so the "current date" is not derived by the system date:

After that you need to insert the following code to automatically update the Current Date on page initialization:

// set current date variable
var yesterday = new Date();
yesterday.setDate(yesterday.getDate() - 1);


// convert date to CurrentDateTime
Application.setCurrentDateTime(
    CurrentDateTime.createCalendarDateTime({
        granularity: CalendarTimeGranularity.Day,
		day: yesterday.getDate(),
        month: yesterday.getMonth()+1, // month is indexed 0-11
        year: yesterday.getFullYear()
    })
);

It will auto update the current date to yesterday. You could use the current date for all your measures.

Kind regards,

Tano

entry.title: Free of Charge Material from Customer with Freight and Import Duty cost to be captured in COGM
entry.content:
Dear All,

Currently I'm facing with a requirement from our client as per below,

When produce a specific product, sometimes they will received a Raw Material as FOC to produce the SFG and FG then sell to the Customer.
When receive those FOC RM, they will bear the cost such as Freight and Import duty.

Question from my end, how we are able to capture such cost since the material is FOC which is a non valuated material and only track for the qty in the system.

But during run the standard cost estimate by our costing team, they should be able to read the information related to Freight and Import duty as a cost structure.
The goals is to track the cost that was coming from Freight and Import duty for those FOC material during run standard cost estimate from Controlling team.

Anyone have such experience ?

Kindly please advise or any suggestion will be appreciated.

entry.title: Shaping the Future of Utilities Together: Advisory Customer Council for Utilities 2025
entry.content:
In today’s fast-evolving world, success is built on connection. When great minds come together, we unlock the power to shape the future together. That spirit of collaboration was at the heart of the Advisory Customer Council for Utilities (ACCU), held on October 1–2, 2025 in Walldorf. This exclusive forum brought together senior executives from leading utility companies and SAP leadership for two days of strategic dialogue, innovation, and co-creation.

A Forum for Strategic Engagement

The ACCU is more than just a meeting,  it's a platform for trusted exchange, visionary thinking, and shaping the future of SAP’s solutions for the utilities sector. This exclusive forum fosters alignment on industry priorities and enables participants to influence SAP’s roadmap in a meaningful way.

Highlights from the Event

We kicked off with a warm and engaging get-together on Day 0, setting the tone for a productive and inspiring agenda. Over the next two days, we heard powerful customer stories from Zelestra, BC Hydro, and E.ON, each offering unique perspectives and insights into their transformation journeys.

SAP leaders shared updates on key topics including:

  • Clean Core
  • SAP Business Technology Platform (BDC)
  • Artificial Intelligence
  • Customer Support & Experience
  • Move to the Cloud
  • Asset Management
  • Distributed Energy Resources

These sessions sparked valuable discussions and reinforced our shared commitment to innovation and excellence.

A Special Moment

A standout moment of the event was the participation of SAP CEO Christian Klein, who joined us for an open conversation. His presence and clear commitment to the utilities industry underscored SAP’s dedication to supporting our customers through this era of transformation.

Experiencing Innovation Firsthand

Participants had the opportunity to visit the SAP Experience Center, where we showcased the SAP Energy Park, a space that highlights SAP as a living example of sustainability in action. Through interactive exhibits and hands-on demonstrations, participants discovered how SAP’s latest solutions are driving the transition to net zero, bringing the future of utilities to life in a dynamic and inspiring environment.

Looking Ahead

We extend our heartfelt thanks to all our customers for their trust, insights, and active participation. Your voices are instrumental in shaping the future of SAP’s utilities solutions. We look forward to continuing this journey together—co-innovating, collaborating, and leading the way into the next era of utilities.

entry.title: Re: SAP SF Onboarding External User First Access Language
entry.content: In addition the Onboarding user is the "first" user on the BizX platform and if he logs in and is changing the default locale to something else you dont want to overwrite this with the HRIS Mapping and also not overwrite it when the user becomes an employee.

entry.title: Re: WHEN CREATING A NEW CARD, NOT ALL MDF SUCCESSFACTORS...
entry.content:
Hi Jhonatan,

Please see https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/implementing-metadata-framework-mdf/mdf-configurations-for-latest-people-profile?locale=en-US

There can be few reason why a MDF object does not show up in the list 

1. The object you are trying to add is already as card into one or other category 

2. If the object is pre-delivered 

3. If object has more than 2 level of composite (parent + child + grand child is allowed) those are not allowed 

Please help check if it is due to any of these reasons.

Regards,

-Narendra
